title.rendered: The ABC of Traveling by Air in Nigeria

content.rendered:
The ABCs of traveling by air in Nigeria are basic and vital things to know about traveling by air in Nigeria. As we have the ABC of traveling by road, we also have it in the air. The ABC of traveling by air must not be neglected as they give light and direction to one’s path. Some of the things this article will discuss under the ABC of traveling by air in Nigeria are;

When Can I Travel?

Most of the time, people are concerned with when they can travel. The truth of the matter is that the country is not safe. There are still recording cases of coronavirus, which is a deadly disease. There are many recorded cases of kidnapping and robbery operations at the airport. One needs to be careful about when to travel. Criminals might be distinguished or posed to be greeters at the airport. They might even confirm your transportation arrangement before your arrival unknowingly.

During the harmattan season, it is not always advisable to travel by air as the harmattan wind is much more in the air, thereby leading to the high blowing of sand and dust. Most pilots might not be able to see far, limiting their visibility, which might sometimes lead to accidents. Flight cancellations and rescheduling of flights are rampant this season in order not to suffer avoidable casualties. Traveling in this period is unsafe if your destination is far away and experiences more harmattan periods than normal.

Before traveling, ensure there are entry, exit, transit, and restrictions requirements for Covid-19. The airport is a gathering of so many people from different places. There should be necessary protocols to check for Covid-19 to avoid spreading deadly diseases. There should be mandatory proof of vaccination or covid-19 testing. Make sure and verify that your airport fulfills covid-19 requirements. Also, check often before you travel the rules and restrictions to prevent the outbreak of Covid-19 and other contaminable diseases like Lassa fever, yellow fever, etc.

Ensure your documents are completed. Traveling by air demands certain processes. Your document must be filled in from registration, flight booking, payment, travel insurance, and getting a ticket. After filling in all requirements, you can travel on the day stated on your ticket. Every ticket has a boarding pass and also a date on it. You must be conversant and regularly check to get updated about the day of your trip.

The current Basic Rules Guiding Traveling by Air in Nigeria

There are certain principles guiding airplane travelers in Nigeria, and some of the rules are;

1. Don’t carry illegal drugs

Airplane travelers are banned from carrying illicit drugs in and out of airports. Anyone found with illegal drugs will face the consequences, and the penalties can be life imprisonment, large fines, the death penalty, prison sentence, etc. The consequences of this action are always severe.

2. Avoid Taking Photographs Beside Military Zone

There are military and police sites in the controlled zone of airports. Avoid taking photographs near them, especially at immigration checkpoints. Other places are free to take photographs, but restricted places are prohibited according to the rules.

3. Take Along Your Document

You don’t need all documents, but to be on the safer side, take all documents along. Your ID card is so essential. Without your ID, you won’t gain entrance into the airplane. Ensure you have your boarding pass printed out or downloaded to your mobile phone to aid your check-in at the airport. Your Covid-test document must never be neglected, as it will be asked of.

4. Timely Arrival

The airport frowns at lateness. Always make sure to come two to four hours before your flight. You can never predict unforeseen circumstances. Checking in at the airport with baggage and some other Covid-19 requirements takes time. So as not to miss your flight, get there early.

5. Know and learn the airport procedures

Every airport has its own rules, procedures, and mode of operation. Before the light, you must check for the rules guiding the airline as well as the guiding rules binding the place you are traveling to. Consequences are always attached if one fails to comply.

6. Be updated

Airlines do urge air travelers to be updated at all times. No one can predict what can happen. One needs to be informed that a flight might be canceled or rescheduled due to circumstances. Always check your flight status and itinerary. Make sure all your details are well documented and there is no error. Check your flight delay advice if your flight date is getting long or delayed. Keep checking until the day of the flight.

7. Don’t use Communication Gadget

During traveling, travelers adhered not to use cell phones or any communication gadgets to avoid interrupting the services on board during the flight. It is dangerous and must be avoided.

The Key Red Flags To Avoid When Traveling By Air To/From Nigeria

In every country, there are certain rules and principles guiding them. Nigeria has some principles that must be adhered to and some dangers that must be avoided. Some of the vital red flags to avoid are;

1. Avoid walking around barefoot

When traveling by air, it is dangerous to walk around barefoot. There are unseen germs on the carpet, and they might contact one if stepped. Sharp objects like broken pieces of glass, needles, etc., might be dangerous to step on.

2. Avoid Taking Ice drink

It is believed that airplanes are closer to cold weather, and thereby, it would be best that you avoid drinking ice or tap water. Try to avoid coffee or tea with cold water when traveling by air.

3. Avoid switching off the air vent

Don’t switch off the air vent to keep you comfortable and chill. Always keep it on to avoid sweats, airborne germs, and breathing in heat. You can keep it at a lower level if too much, but don’t switch it off. It also helps in keeping your skin wet.

4. Avoid Sitting on a spot during the entire flight

It is bad; sitting in a spot for the entire flight is unhygienic. It can cause disease, especially vein thrombosis, whereby a blood clot will be formed in your legs. Move around at least twice, depending on the length of your traveling. If you can’t move around, try some exercise in your seat. Lift your leg as often.

Are you Traveling by Air? Travel With Emmye Travels

The ABCs of traveling by air in Nigeria are vital things you need to be conversant with to make the best of your traveling. I hope this article covers everything you need about the ABC of traveling by air in Nigeria.

You can always trust us at Emmye Travel to help you with everything about your local and international traveling. We consider you, and we plan your traveling based on your prescription. You have nothing to worry about when you reach out to us.

We have had good reviews from our customers over the years. You can always trust us anytime to give you the premium comfort you deserve. We are always available for all your traveling reservations. Contact us now (+2347031356395) to make a traveling booking within and outside Nigeria. You can also visit our website to check out all our services and packages.

We hold our customers in high esteem!
